page.title: 10FARMING OWERSBY POULTRY
page.content: Since the 1950's egg production has become intensive and moved indoors. It is practised on one farm in this area being associated with a cereal growing enterprise to provide a large proport- ion of the poultry food.Manure from the birds is used to fertilize grass- land on the same holding.The laying hens are housed in an environment where light and temperature are con- trolled to give an even production of eggs throughout the year.The 21'c.temp enables efficient egg production with economical food consumption.Day old chicks are housed on peat moss under gas heaters,the heat being reduced over 2-3 weeks until they can manage to generate enough for themselves.At 18 weeks of age they are housed in cages for the duration of a laying period of approximately 13 months.
